reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the Classic Villa as our first choice in Christchurch, The George, was fully booked. It is centrally located right on the edge of Christchurch's still closed Red Zone city centre. There is a good choice of restaurants and bars within easy walking distance and is a steady 20 minute drive to the airport.
reviews.title: OK for the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The property is split into the original Victorian villa with some 4-5 rooms and a fairly modern extension to the rear with 3 or 4 rooms in it. We had a spacious two room suite in the rear modern extension. The rooms were spacious, nicely equipped and quiet. The older villa section appeared to contain standard rooms which seemed rather gloomy with the Victorian wood pannelling. Braekfast is served communally in a large dining room and is pretty average.
reviews.title: Beautiful home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Classic Villa is OK if lacking in ambience. From choice we would stay at Ther George.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It felt like home walking in the door. This b & b is located half a block from the beautiful botanical gardens and down the street from downtown area. Breakfast was a huge variety of fruits, cereals, rolls, meats, juices, etc. The hosts were very pleasant and accomodating. A warm living room area and outdoor area. They even helped me find a bus companay to go to the coast. I would highly recommend this to someone going to Christchurch.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a small boutique hotel with loads of atmosphere - it used to be an old Rectory. We had a lovely big room during our first two nights (room 1) – others are smaller and if you can get that room 1, I would recommend it. The rooms include a very big step-in shower.
reviews.title: A classy hotel. Great breakfasts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: The hotel has a big breakfast/coffee area and you can help yourself to tea and coffee whenever you want. The quality of the breakfast is brilliant. There is Madeira wine near the rooms that guests can help themselves to, which is a lovely touch.
reviews.title: Welcome experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed altogether for 3 nights – 2 nights initially and then another night later on before we flew home from the airport. For most of the time an absolutely lovely lady “Nonni” looked after us (not sure if this is the right spelling of your name, Nonni). She couldn’t do enough for us and is so fascinating to talk to. A wonderful hostess.
reviews.title: great place - awesome breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: There is one reason I can’t give this an excellent rating is that the owner Peter has not provided information that is desperately needed. After the earthquake and subsequent problems, the centre of Christchurch is in bad shape and many buildings have been “red stickered” which means they are considered unsafe. So many restaurants and shops have moved elsewhere. Also, many roads are closed and it appears this changes often. We had to fend for ourselves and Peter did not provide a list of restaurants and where they are and how to drive there. The only thing he did was when we asked him he suggested one restaurant. When we got there it was totally full and it took us nearly an hour to find another one which was open/had tables. It seems other hotels are providing lists of restaurants and how to get there and we strongly suggest that Peter does this.
reviews.title: Spotless property with delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For tourists going to Christchurch you should realise that not much is open in the centre. This hotel is opposite the arts Centre, which is closed and so is the art gallery. The Botanical Gardens are as beautiful as ever, but all the buildings within its precinct are closed.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing location, across from the art center (hope this will re-open soon!) and steps from the beautiful botanic gardens and informative and interesting museum. Large room with toasty fireplace, comfy bed and nice bathroom. Internet access. Nice breakfast. Pretty patio. Very friendly and welcoming hosts.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked by our tour leader, Robert of Tailored Travel.
reviews.title: Beautiful old house in the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great big room, very clean, rather helpful staff, free internet, great breakfast served by the staff. Guests share a kitchen and a living room so you might feel almost like at home. Very social atmosphere during the breakfast since all guests sit around one big table; very unusual! Lots of books and magazines available as well as coffee, tea and fruit during the stay. Perfect location!
reviews.title: the true meaning of hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners of the Classic Villa are dedicated to hospitality. We were supposed to stay in the Classic Villa from March 14-16th, but because of the devastating earthquake in downtown Christchurch our reservations had been cancelled. The reason was because the Classic Villa had not yet received electricty or water. The owners, Peter and Jan, offered to host us in their home until the Classic Villa was up and running. We stayed with them and received a Kiwi welcome that could not have been more gracious. By the time we left Christchurch on March 16th the Classic Villa had reopened. It is one of the only lodgings in downtown Christchurch that are accepting guests--and it is a lovely boutique accomodation.
reviews.title: A great place to stay with service over and above

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't thank Peter and Jan enough. They gave us a memorable beginning to our 2 week vacation in New Zealand.
reviews.title: meticulously run, central but quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in out 3 week trip round NZ. It is in a lovely location on Worcester Boulevard, right next to the arts centre which is the old building of the UNiversity of Canterbury. It is right next to the botanical gardens and a short walk from Cathedral Square and the main streets. Good room, well furnished. Good breakfast aswell. The staff service and room rate are average, i.e. perfectly fine but nothing special.
reviews.title: Probably the best location in Christchurch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This bed & breakfast is located near the botanical gardens, and walking distance to all the major attractions. The BB has free WIFI, and breakfast and the host (Peter) are wonderful. Free parking is available and would recommend renting a car to travel around the city. There is no gym but a YMCA is around the corner. The rooms are small but functional. There is no pool. Kids are not allowed. I would recommend this place for the location.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Classic Villa is centrally located in Christchurch in the arts precient. It's actually quiet and a easy walk to most restaurants and CHCH central. In fact walk up the street and 1km is the Catherdal and city square.
reviews.title: Great Location-Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Included in your tariff is breakfast from their communal kitchen (extra for cooked breakfast) which had fresh fruit, cereals and different varities of bread and cindiments.
reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel and Earthquake Proof!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very clean and with refurbished rooms in the older section this B & B is just terrific.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
